page.title: 03Church Activities
page.content: The church of St Andrew is much more than a centre of religion for a great many clubs and societies are based there.For boys there are Cubs and Scouts and for girls there are Brownies and Guides.Apart from their normal weekly meetings there are special services and parades.For older parishioners there is the Mothers' Union and the Men's Society.The Mothers' Union was founded in 1876 by Mary Somner,wife of the rector of Old Almsford,Hampshire, who was greatly concerned with the Christian upbringing of both her own children and those of other young mothers locally.Members of the Men's Society are committed church men and find it helpful to discuss their beliefs knowing that sincere discussion helps to form sound condition.
